I stumbled into this place for lunch after a hot afternoon of wandering and shopping.  I was hoping for a nice glass of wine and much needed A/C, but the food was out of this world.  I had the soft egg with prosciutto, steak tartar and oyster tapas.  All were delicious.  Presentation was beautiful.  Even the bread was better than other restaurants.  I highly recommend it.  The portions are on the smaller side so if you are more than one person you may need double orders if you want more than a few bites each.
